tweets.text:
And now we know why government have been so busy over the last couple of days.

In 2019 water companies spent over 3,100,000 hours, on over 400,000 occasions dumping sh*t into our rivers and seas.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/sUsBYs5msz

We are responding to a serious fish kill at Newton-Le-Willows #StHelens. Our officers & @sthelenscouncil are investigating the cause & taking action to avoid any further fish deaths

Our thanks go to the fast-acting members of the public who reported this to us on 0800 80 70 60

tweets.text: @StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @RedIndustries2 Day after day, after day, night after night - @NewsNBC are living the groundhog stink day...How many more complaints do the @EnvAgency are needed? It‚Äôs woke my family up again... This is a health crisis, time for the Secretary of State for the environment to act  #stopthestink https://t.co/vmK1dPZmpF

Another night when thousands of houses get gassed @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency What punishment should @RedIndustries2  have for gassing a community? This can't be allowed to continue.

Martin Hughes and his wife were flooded on Boxing Day 2015

He tells us his story of what it‚Äôs like to be flooded and shares his advice for others üëáüèº 

Know what to do in a flood: https://t.co/whMiqucyL6 #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/b52BSUBbky

With support from @cardiffuni @WUFoundation & @EnvAgency we‚Äôre designing a citizen science project to monitor water quality (including phosphate levels) on the Upper Wye. Let‚Äôs use people power to fill the data gap! https://t.co/nvtTcyuCBR https://t.co/LdLe6VQIbH

#Water firms discharged raw #sewage into rivers and coastal waters in England more than 400,000 times last yr, says @EnvAgency.  How did they manage to get away with this behaviour  so long? Is it the need to keep bills down? @AnglingTrust @angling_times @CraigBennett3
@EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgency Can‚Äôt connect to it lads! https://t.co/OrDkKkR1pd
@EnvAgencyYNE Cannot reach website!

Do you know where the water from your dishwasher, washing machine, bath or shower goes? 

Misconnected properties can pollute rivers and seas and harm wildlife. Check your property is connected right. 

For more info https://t.co/hKtRdkmPtK 

#NationalDrainageMisconnectionDay https://t.co/IJ9CzszydQ

urls.description: Are you after some advice for a water-based development? Unsure where to direct your call? Phone our Midlands office on 01332 871 882 or our North office 01748 889 268, and we will pass you through to correct team. We look forward to hearing from you!

urls.title: Natural flood management work continues on Ilkley Moor
urls.description: Work has started on a project to further slow down the flow of water from Ilkley Moor into Backstone Beck which runs to the River Wharfe. The Environment Agency funded project which was Commissioned by Bradford Council with the support of the Friends of Ilkley Moor, which is being carried out b

tweets.text: üêüBreeding brook lampreys! Matt from DWT was excited to spot these primitive, eel-like fish in the River Torridge! These fish are rarely seen and spend most of their lives in the stream bed as larva, before turning into adults and swimming upstream to spawn! #TRRP #WEG @EnvAgency https://t.co/sMZarGLmyg

@Sian29337182 @MrMarkwarren1 Hottest March Day  in 52 years... quite a balmy evening 14 degrees. This does not bode well for the summer. ü§Æü§Æü§¢When will @NewsNBC be providing Hazmat suits for the summer? urls.title: Event duration monitoring ‚Äì lifting the lid on storm overflows
urls.description: On today's blog we look into the 2020 Event Duration Monitoring Data, which is fundamental to understanding and improving the environment.¬†
